articles.title: Boston City Council shows mixed support for rent control ballot question
articles.description:
While advocates push for a 2026 ballot question on rent control, a City Council measure supporting that effort was objected to this week.

The post Boston City Council shows mixed support for rent control ballot question appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston City Council debated a measure on rent control support this week.
Advocates aim for a rent control ballot question in 2026.
Mixed council support may affect housing affordability for Boston residents.

articles.title: Haim praises Brick Street Bagels: ‘Bomb bagels’
articles.description:
The band gushed over this beloved local bakery.

The post Haim praises Brick Street Bagels: ‘Bomb bagels’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Haim, the band, praised Brick Street Bagels for their exceptional quality on September 11, 2025.
The bakery is a beloved local spot, attracting attention from both residents and visitors.
Increased recognition may boost foot traffic and sales for Brick Street Bagels in Boston.

articles.title: Thieves in Quincy are ordering pizzas then stealing the driver’s car, police say
articles.description:
Two nearly identical thefts happened in recent weeks.

The post Thieves in Quincy are ordering pizzas then stealing the driver’s car, police say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Quincy police report two recent pizza delivery car thefts in the area.
Thieves ordered pizzas and stole the delivery driver's car in both incidents.
Residents are advised to remain vigilant during deliveries to prevent theft.

articles.title: Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor
articles.description:
Scott Merchant, 36, of Salisbury, has pleaded not guilty.

The post Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Scott Merchant, 36, from Salisbury, faces charges for bomb threats to an Everett councilor.
Merchant pleaded not guilty in court on September 11, 2025.
Threats raise safety concerns for Everett residents and local government officials.
